intro: Peucedanum stenospermum, commonly known as narrow-seeded angelica, is a flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to southern Europe and western Asia, often found in dry, rocky habitats. The plant has slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with finely divided lobes, and it produces small, oval fruits. It is valued for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine.
